verses.verse: Listen <WH8085>, O isles<WH339>, unto me<WH7181>; and hearken, ye peoples<WH3816>, from far<WH7350>: Jehovah<WH3068> hath called<WH7121> me from the womb<WH990>; from the bowels<WH4578> of my mother<WH517> hath he made mention<WH2142> of my name<WH8034>:

and he hath made<WH7760> my mouth<WH6310> like a sharp<WH2299> sword<WH2719>; in the shadow<WH6738> of his hand<WH3027> hath he hid<WH2244> me<WH7760>: and he hath made me a polished<WH1305> shaft<WH2671>; in his quiver<WH827> hath he kept me close<WH5641>:
and he said<WH559> unto me<WH5650>, Thou art my servant; Israel<WH3478>, in whom I will be glorified<WH6286>.

But I said<WH559>, I have labored<WH3021> in vain<WH7385>, I have spent<WH3615> my strength<WH3581> for nought<WH8414> and vanity<WH1892>; yet surely<WH403> the justice<WH4941> due to me is with Jehovah<WH3068>, and my recompense<WH6468> with my God<WH430>.

And now saith<WH559> Jehovah<WH3068> that formed<WH3335> me from the womb<WH990> to be his servant<WH5650>, to bring<WH7725> Jacob<WH3290> again<WH7725> to him<WH3478>, and that Israel be gathered<WH622> unto him<WH3513> (for I am honorable in the eyes<WH5869> of Jehovah<WH3068>, and my God<WH430> is become my strength<WH5797>);

yea <WH559>, he saith, It is too light a thing<WH7043> that thou shouldest be my servant<WH5650> to raise up<WH6965> the tribes<WH7626> of Jacob<WH3290>, and to restore<WH7725> the preserved<WH5341> of Israel<WH3478>: I will also give<WH5414> thee for a light<WH216> to the Gentiles<WH1471>, that thou mayest be my salvation<WH3444> unto the end<WH7097> of the earth<WH776>.

Thus saith<WH559> Jehovah<WH3068>, the Redeemer<WH1350> of Israel<WH3478>, and his Holy One<WH6918>, to him whom man<WH5315> despiseth<WH960>, to him whom the nation<WH1471> abhorreth<WH8581>, to a servant<WH5650> of rulers<WH4910>: Kings<WH4428> shall see<WH7200> and arise<WH6965>; princes<WH8269>, and they shall worship<WH7812>; because of Jehovah<WH3068> that is faithful<WH539>, even the Holy One<WH6918> of Israel<WH3478>, who hath chosen thee<WH977>.

Thus saith<WH559> Jehovah<WH3068>, In an acceptable<WH7522> time<WH6256> have I answered<WH6030> thee<WH3117>, and in a day of salvation<WH3444> have I helped<WH5826> thee<WH5341>; and I will preserve thee<WH5414>, and give thee for a covenant<WH1285> of the people<WH5971>, to raise<WH6965> up the land<WH776>, to make them inherit<WH5157> the desolate<WH8074> heritages<WH5159>:

saying <WH559> to them that are bound<WH631>, Go forth<WH3318>; to them that are in darkness<WH2822>, Show<WH1540> yourselves<WH7462>. They shall feed in the ways<WH1870>, and on all bare heights<WH8205> shall be their pasture<WH4830>.

They shall not hunger<WH7456> nor thirst<WH6770>; neither shall the heat<WH8273> nor sun<WH8121> smite<WH5221> them<WH7355>: for he that hath mercy on them will lead<WH5090> them<WH4002>, even by springs of water<WH4325> will he guide them<WH5095>.
And I will make<WH7760> all my mountains<WH2022> a way<WH1870>, and my highways<WH4546> shall be exalted<WH7311>.
Lo <WH935>, these shall come from far<WH7350>; and<WH6828>, lo, these from the north and from the west<WH3220>; and these from the land<WH776> of Sinim<WH5515>.

Sing <WH7442>, O heavens<WH8064>; and be joyful<WH1523>, O earth<WH776>; and break forth<WH6476> into singing<WH7440>, O mountains<WH2022>: for Jehovah<WH3068> hath comforted<WH5162> his people<WH5971>, and will have compassion<WH7355> upon his afflicted<WH6041>.
But Zion<WH6726> said<WH559>, Jehovah<WH3068> hath forsaken<WH5800> me<WH3068>, and the Lord hath forgotten me<WH7911>.

Can a woman<WH802> forget<WH7911> her sucking child<WH5764>, that she should not have compassion<WH7355> on the son<WH1121> of her womb<WH990>? yea<WH7911>, these may forget, yet will not I forget thee<WH7911>.
Behold <WH2710>, I have graven thee upon the palms of my hands<WH3709>; thy walls<WH2346> are continually before me<WH8548>.
Thy children<WH1121> make haste<WH4116>; thy destroyers<WH2040> and they that made thee waste<WH2717> shall go forth from thee<WH3318>.

Lift up<WH5375> thine eyes<WH5869> round about<WH5439>, and behold<WH7200>: all these gather themselves together<WH6908>, and come<WH935> to thee<WH2416>. As I live, saith<WH5002> Jehovah<WH3068>, thou shalt surely clothe<WH3847> thee with them all as with an ornament<WH5716>, and gird<WH7194> thyself with them<WH3618>, like a bride.

For <WH2723>, as for thy waste and thy desolate places<WH8074>, and thy land<WH776> that hath been destroyed<WH2035>, surely now shalt thou be too strait<WH3334> for the inhabitants<WH3427>, and they that swallowed thee up<WH1104> shall be far away<WH7368>.
The children<WH1121> of thy bereavement<WH7923> shall yet say<WH559> in thine ears<WH241>, The place<WH4725> is too strait<WH6862> for me<WH5066>; give place<WH4725> to me that I may dwell<WH3427>.

Then shalt thou say<WH559> in thy heart<WH3824>, Who hath begotten<WH3205> me these<WH7921>, seeing I have been bereaved of my children, and am solitary<WH1565>, an exile<WH1540>, and wandering to and fro<WH5493>? and who hath brought up<WH1431> these<WH7604>? Behold, I was left alone<WH375>; these, where were they?

Thus saith<WH559> the Lord<WH136> Jehovah<WH3069>, Behold<WH5375>, I will lift up my hand<WH3027> to the nations<WH1471>, and set up<WH7311> my ensign<WH5251> to the peoples<WH5971>; and they shall bring<WH935> thy sons<WH1121> in their bosom<WH2684>, and thy daughters<WH1323> shall be carried<WH5375> upon their shoulders<WH3802>.

And kings<WH4428> shall be thy nursing fathers<WH539>, and their queens<WH8282> thy nursing mothers<WH3243>: they shall bow down<WH7812> to thee with their faces<WH639> to the earth<WH776>, and lick<WH3897> the dust<WH6083> of thy feet<WH7272>; and thou shalt know<WH3045> that I am Jehovah<WH3068>; and they that wait<WH6960> for me shall not be put to shame<WH954>.
Shall the prey<WH4455> be taken<WH3947> from the mighty<WH1368>, or the lawful<WH6662> captives<WH7628> be delivered<WH4422>?

But thus saith<WH559> Jehovah<WH3068>, Even the captives<WH7628> of the mighty<WH1368> shall be taken away<WH3947>, and the prey<WH4455> of the terrible<WH6184> shall be delivered<WH4422>; for I will contend<WH7378> with him that contendeth<WH3401> with thee<WH3467>, and I will save thy children<WH1121>.

And I will feed<WH398> them that oppress<WH3238> thee with their own flesh<WH1320>; and they shall be drunken<WH7937> with their own blood<WH1818>, as with sweet wine<WH6071>: and all flesh<WH1320> shall know<WH3045> that I<WH3068>, Jehovah, am thy Saviour<WH3467>, and thy Redeemer<WH1350>, the Mighty One<WH46> of Jacob<WH3290>.
